sub_title: Full Stack Developer | Founder JRevolt | Java Expert at JRevolt
summary:
"The only way to do great work is to love what you do. If you haven't found it yet, keep looking. Don't settle. As with all matters of the heart, you'll know when you find it." - Steve Jobs

As a full stack developer with a strong focus on the Java platform, I have a wealth of experience in creating effective solutions for a wide range of projects. With experience working for various companies in the Netherlands, I have honed my skills in both back-end and front-end development, allowing me to create dynamic and visually appealing web applications.

I am skilled in a variety of tools and technologies, including Spring Boot, Hibernate, REST, DevOps, SCRUM, Jenkins, and Liquibase. These skills, combined with my strong engineering background and bachelor's degree in Information Technology from Hanzehogeschool Groningen / Hanze University of Applied Sciences Groningen, have allowed me to excel in my career as a developer.

In addition to my technical skills, I am a strong communicator and able to effectively convey my ideas to both technical and non-technical audiences. I am proficient in English and Dutch, and I have a proven track record of working effectively with clients and team members from a variety of cultural backgrounds.
As a freelancer, I am highly motivated and committed to delivering top-quality work for my clients. I have a passion for problem-solving and finding creative solutions to complex challenges. I am able to work independently or as part of a team, and I am comfortable taking on leadership roles when necessary.

Overall, I am a driven and dedicated full stack developer with a passion for creating innovative solutions for my clients. I am confident in my ability to contribute to the success of any project, and I am always eager to take on new challenges and opportunities to further my career.
Ready to take your project to the next level? Contact me to discuss how my expertise in Java and full stack development can help bring your vision to your project.

school.name: Hanzehogeschool Groningen / Hanze University of Applied Sciences Groningen

projects.title: Surgerybooking.com
projects.description:
A freelance project an Enteprise Java application with REST API, Spring boot Cloud on backend and Angular on the frond end. This application provides services to clinics, doctors and to clients who can book surgeries after having a consultation. This project was delivered to the owner of surgery booking.com and was deployed to acceptance environment with following functionalities:

Backend Java and Frontend Angular v14,
Software Design Architecture,
Software Infrastructure,
OAuth with JWT,
OAuth 2.1 with Google and Facebook,
User Role Management,
Clinic Management,
Clinic Invites,
Admin Portal,
API integration Google API and Neutrino API,
Email verification and two way verification's,
Mail Templates,
Responsive Design,
Apache Kafka Messaging service,
Push notifications,
Docker Container Compositions(Portainer, Nginix proxy manager),
DevOps CICD automatation deployment pipeline,
Unit testing Mockito and Cypress
PostgresSQL

contributors.headline: Full Stack Developer | Founder JRevolt | Java Expert at JRevolt
Software Engineer at Millennium Information Solution Ltd.

profile_positions.description:
I recently had the opportunity to develop a website using Java EE CDI beans. This project required the use of a variety of techniques and tools, including CDI (Dependency Injection), Java Beans, JSF (Java Server Faces), JavaScript, jQuery, HTML5, CSS, XML, SSH, GlassFish, Maven, and the JavaMail API.
The project was a great learning experience for me, as it allowed me to further develop my skills in Java development and web design. I was able to utilize my knowledge of CDI and Java Beans to effectively implement dependency injection in the project, and I used JSF to create a user-friendly interface for the website.

In addition to Java development, I also utilized my skills in JavaScript, jQuery, HTML5, and CSS to create dynamic and visually appealing elements on the website. I used XML to structure and organize data, and I employed SSH and GlassFish to securely deploy the website.

Throughout the project, I utilized Maven to manage dependencies and build the website, and I used the JavaMail API to enable the website to send emails.
Overall, this project was a great opportunity for me to apply my skills in Java development and web design to create a fully functional website.
profile_positions.title: Full Stack Java Developer

profile_positions.description:
I have a diverse range of experience in various technologies and tools, including infrastructure, CI/CD, Docker, Git, GitLab, Springboot, Angular CLI, and JAX-RS.
One of my key areas of expertise is infrastructure, where I have gained experience in designing and implementing robust and scalable systems. I have worked with a variety of technologies to build infrastructure, including Docker and GitLab, and I am proficient in using Git for version control and collaboration.
I have also gained extensive experience in CI/CD, with a strong focus on automating the build, test, and deployment process. I have used tools such as Jenkins and GitLab CI to set up continuous integration and continuous delivery pipelines, and I have a deep understanding of the benefits and best practices of CI/CD.
In addition to my skills in infrastructure and CI/CD, I have also gained experience in Springboot and Angular CLI. I have used Springboot to develop and deploy cloud-native applications, and I have utilized Angular CLI to create and manage Angular projects.
Finally, I have experience in JAX-RS, a Java API for RESTful web services. I have used JAX-RS to create and deploy RESTful APIs, and I am skilled in using it to develop scalable and flexible web services.
Overall, my diverse experience in infrastructure, CI/CD, Docker, Docker Container Orchestration, Git, GitLab, Springboot, Angular CLI, and JAX-RS has allowed me to become a well-rounded developer with a strong skill set.
